document_title: Anxiety disorders: Causes, diagnosis and treatment methods
subsection_content:
It's difficult to determine the cause of anxiety disorders, but there are some risk factors that make one individual more likely to develop an anxiety disorder than another.
Genetics: Anxiety disorders also have genetic factors. Researchers in the US have shown that if parents or family members have a history of mental illness, their children will be at high risk of experiencing this illness. Psychological factors: Childhood psychological trauma, anxiety-prone personality traits... Environmental and social factors: prolonged stress, tensions from family, living environment, work environment... neurochemical factors; Genetics: Anxiety disorders also have genetic factors.
